t: God,*p who at various times and in various ways spoke in time past to the fathers by the prophets,
has in these last days spoken to us by His*i Son, whom He has appointed heir of all things, through whom also He made the worlds;

who being the brightness of His*i glory and the express image of His person, and upholding all things by the word of His power, when He had by Himself purged our sins, sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high,
having become so much better than the angels, as He has by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.
For*p to which of the angels did He ever say: “You*pn are My Son, Today*ld I have begotten You”? And*p again: “I*pn will be to Him a Father, And*ld He shall be to Me a Son”?
But*p when He again brings the firstborn into the world, He says: “Let*pn all the angels of God worship Him.”
And*p of the angels He says: “Who*pn makes His angels spirits And*ld His ministers a flame of fire.”
But*p to the Son He*i says:*i “Your*pn throne, O God, is*i forever and ever; A*ld scepter of righteousness is*i the scepter of Your kingdom.
You*ld have loved righteousness and hated lawlessness; Therefore*ld God, Your God, has anointed You With*ld the oil of gladness more than Your companions.”
And:*p “You,*pn Lord,*sb in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth, And*ld the heavens are the work of Your hands.
They*ld will perish, but You remain; And*ld they will all grow old like a garment;
Like*ld a cloak You will fold them up, And*ld they will be changed. But*ld You are the same, And*ld Your years will not fail.”
But*p to which of the angels has He ever said: “Sit*pn at My right hand, Till*ld I make Your enemies Your footstool”?
Are*p they not all ministering spirits sent forth to minister for those who will inherit salvation?
